intro: Terminalia beccarii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It is often found in moist forested areas and is valued for its hard, durable wood. Terminalia beccarii also has traditional medicinal uses in various African cultures.
